content.description: This climb is the ideal climb in spearfish canyon, Awesome jugs all the way up and just before the crux is a HUGE jug you can get half your whole arm in.
content.protection: 9 Bolts and open shunt anchors at top
content.location: this is the last route on the wall, on an arete by it self.

content.description: This route is up the arete/prow, great climb, crux is at the most over hanging part, there are a couple of sweet heel hooks on the climb.
content.location: this route is the second route on the wall, up the prow.

content.description: Climb the first 4 bolts of Never Kiss a Sleeping Wolf, then go right and clip the last three bolts of Lady in Red. Put long runners on bolts 2, 4, and 5 if you like. Climbs the good part of Lady without the chossy easy climbing.Â
This is a great route, on a overhung wall with good pockets of all sorts with the exception of monos.
content.protection: 5 bolts and some new chains and belay rings on the end of chains.
content.location: this is the route on the over hanging wall, on the left side of the first arete.

content.description: Great climb up good holds to a pinchy crux.
content.protection: 7 bolts and chain anchors at top
content.location: this route is the first on the wall right side of the wall, starts up a bit of a dihedral, then up the wall.

content.description:
Nice pockets to cruxy moves half way up, then the real crux with poor feet up top.  Book says it's a thinker, that sounds about right. 

  I think I have some photos I will submit.
content.location: Immediately right of Yippey-Kiy-Yay on the face.

content.description: This area has four excellent routes including the quintessential jug-haul, Yippee-Kiy-Yay (5.10b). The climbing style ranges from the steep and powerful Legends of T (12a) to the very sequential Never Kiss a Sleeping Wolf (11d). All four routes feature excellent pocket-pulling.
